definition: to cast sidelong glances at sb

sentences.english: The old lady at the desk leered at her knowingly.
sentences.chinese: 辦公桌旁的老太婆會心地斜睨了她一眼。

sentences.english: Sargent peered askance through his slanted glasses.
sentences.chinese: 薩金特透過歪戴着的眼鏡斜睨着他。

sentences.english: Walter squints vainly for a chair.
sentences.chinese: 沃爾特斜睨着眼找椅子，但是沒找到。

sentences.english: She slowly arrange down again, inclined Ni the walls clock on the afterward wall, 12:30.
sentences.chinese: 她慢慢又躺了下來，斜睨了下牆上的掛鐘，十二點半。

sentences.english: Do you play chess?" he asked, looking askance at Miguel."
sentences.chinese: “你會下棋嗎？”他斜睨着米格爾問道。

definition: to shoot a glance/glance/to appear in a flash
like a smile yet not a smile (idiom)
to glower (at sb)/to cast an angry look
to curl one's lip/to twitch one's mouth
to sneer/to laugh grimly/grin of dissatisfaction (bitterness, helplessness, indignation etc)/bitter, grim, sarcastic or angry smile
to put on a fake smile (idiom)/to smile insincerely
